```{r}
set.seed(42)
y <- df$DEATH_EVENT
X <- df %>% select(-DEATH_EVENT, -time) %>% as.data.frame()
index <- createDataPartition(y, p = .7, list = FALSE)
train <- df[index, ]
test <- df[-index, ]

trainX <- train %>% select(-DEATH_EVENT) %>% data.matrix()
testX <- test %>% select(-DEATH_EVENT) %>% data.matrix()
trainY <- train$DEATH_EVENT
testY <- test$DEATH_EVENT

model <- glm(trainY ~ trainX, family = binomial(link = "logit"))
summary(model)
```

```{r}
stan_model_code <- "
data {
  int<lower=0> N;                     // Number of observations
  int<lower=0, upper=1> y[N];         // Binary outcome variable
  vector[N] age;                      // Continuous predictor
  vector[N] anaemia;                  // Continuous or binary predictor
  vector[N] creatinine_phosphokinase; // Continuous predictor
  vector[N] diabetes;                 // Binary predictor
  vector[N] ejection_fraction;        // Continuous predictor
  vector[N] high_blood_pressure;      // Binary predictor
  vector[N] platelets;                // Continuous predictor
  vector[N] serum_creatinine;         // Continuous predictor
  vector[N] serum_sodium;             // Continuous predictor
  vector[N] sex;                      // Binary predictor
  vector[N] smoking;                  // Binary predictor
  vector[N] time;                     // Continuous predictor
}
parameters {
  real alpha;                         // Intercept
  real beta_age;
  real beta_anaemia;
  real beta_cpk;                      // Coefficient for creatinine phosphokinase
  real beta_diabetes;
  real beta_ef;                       // Coefficient for ejection fraction
  real beta_hbp;                      // Coefficient for high blood pressure
  real beta_platelets;
  real beta_s_creatinine;             // Coefficient for serum creatinine
  real beta_s_sodium;                 // Coefficient for serum sodium
  real beta_sex;
  real beta_smoking;
  real beta_time;
}
model {
  // Priors
  alpha ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_age ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_anaemia ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_cpk ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_diabetes ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_ef ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_hbp ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_platelets ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_s_creatinine ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_s_sodium ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_sex ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_smoking ~ normal(0, 10);
  beta_time ~ normal(0, 10);
  
  // Likelihood
  for (i in 1:N)
    y[i] ~ bernoulli_logit(alpha + beta_age * age[i] + beta_anaemia * anaemia[i] + beta_cpk * creatinine_phosphokinase[i] +
                           beta_diabetes * diabetes[i] + beta_ef * ejection_fraction[i] + beta_hbp * high_blood_pressure[i] +
                           beta_platelets * platelets[i] + beta_s_creatinine * serum_creatinine[i] + beta_s_sodium * serum_sodium[i] +
                           beta_sex * sex[i] + beta_smoking * smoking[i] + beta_time * time[i]);
}
"
data_for_stan <- list(
  N = length(y),
  y = as.integer(y),
  age = as.numeric(df$age),
  anaemia = as.numeric(df$anaemia),
  creatinine_phosphokinase = as.numeric(df$creatinine_phosphokinase),
  diabetes = as.numeric(df$diabetes),
  ejection_fraction = as.numeric(df$ejection_fraction),
  high_blood_pressure = as.numeric(df$high_blood_pressure),
  platelets = as.numeric(df$platelets),
  serum_creatinine = as.numeric(df$serum_creatinine),
  serum_sodium = as.numeric(df$serum_sodium),
  sex = as.numeric(df$sex),
  smoking = as.numeric(df$smoking),
  time = as.numeric(df$time)
)

fit <- stan(model_code = stan_model_code, data = data_for_stan, iter = 3000, chains = 4, warmup = 1000, seed = 101)
print(fit)
```

```{r}
samples <- extract(fit)
continuous_params <- c("alpha", "beta_age", "beta_cpk", "beta_ef", "beta_platelets", 
                       "beta_s_sodium", "beta_time")

# Loop through each parameter
for (param in continuous_params) {
  # Get samples for the parameter
  param_samples <- samples[[param]]
  
  # Calculate the 95% CI
  ci <- quantile(param_samples, probs = c(0.025, 0.975))
  
  # Print the CI
  cat("95% CI for", param, ":", ci, "\n")
  
  # Create a data frame for ggplot
  df <- data.frame(value = param_samples)
  
  # Plot histogram using ggplot2
  p <- ggplot(df, aes(x = value)) +
    geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "lightblue", color = "black") +
    ggtitle(paste("Histogram of posterior", param)) +
    xlab(param) +
    ylab("Frequency") +
    theme_minimal()
  
  # Print the plot
  print(p)
}
```
